  3/** @file    support.hpp
  4    @author  Jules Bergmann
  5    @date    2005-01-18
  6    @brief   VSIPL++ Library: [support] basic macros, types, exceptions,
  7             and support functions.
  8
  9    This file declares the basic macros, types, exceptions, and support
 10    functions used throughout the VSIPL++ library as specified in the
 11    [support] section of the VSIPL++ specification.
 12*/
 13
 14#ifndef VSIP_SUPPORT_HPP
 15#define VSIP_SUPPORT_HPP

 30/***********************************************************************
 31  Macros
 32***********************************************************************/
 33
 34/// The maximum number of dimensions supported by this implementation.
 35#define VSIP_MAX_DIMENSION 3
 36
 37/// If the compiler provides a way to annotate functions with an
 38/// indication that they never return (except possibly by throwing an
 39/// exception), then VSIP_NORETURN is defined to that annotation,
 40/// otherwise it is defined to nothing.
 41/// GCC supports it, as does Green Hills, as well as Intel.
 42/// The latter defines __GNUC__, too.
 43#if __GNUC__ >= 2 || defined(__ghs__)
 44#  define VSIP_IMPL_NORETURN __attribute__ ((__noreturn__))
 45#else
 46#  define VSIP_IMPL_NORETURN
 47#endif
 48
 49
 50
 51/// If the compiler provides a way to annotate functions with an
 52/// indication that they should not be inlined, then VSIP_IMPL_NOINLINE
 53/// is defined to that annotation, otherwise it is defined to
 54/// nothing. 
 55///
 56/// Greenhills does not use this attribute.
 57#if __GNUC__ >= 2
 58#  define VSIP_IMPL_NOINLINE __attribute__ ((__noinline__))
 59#else
 60#  define VSIP_IMPL_NOINLINE
 61#endif
 62
 63
 64
 65/// If the compiler provides a way to annotate functions that every
 66/// call inside the function should be inlined, then VSIP_IMPL_FLATTEN
 67/// is defined to that annotation, otherwise it is defined to nothing.
 68#if __GNUC__ >= 4
 69#  define VSIP_IMPL_FLATTEN __attribute__ ((__flatten__))
 70#else
 71#  define VSIP_IMPL_FLATTEN
 72#endif
 73
 74
 75
 76/// Loop vectorization pragmas.
 77#if __INTEL_COMPILER && !__ICL
 78#  define PRAGMA_IVDEP _Pragma("ivdep")
 79#  define PRAGMA_VECTOR_ALWAYS _Pragma("vector always")
 80#else
 81#  define PRAGMA_IVDEP
 82#  define PRAGMA_VECTOR_ALWAYS
 83#endif
 84
 85
 86/// Controls whether this VSIPL++ implementation throws exceptions.
 87
 88/// This implementation supports exceptions, but their use can be
 89/// disabled by setting this flag to zero.  The library must then
 90/// be recompiled.
 91
 92/// When set to non-zero, the implementation will throw exceptions as
 93/// required by the specification.  When set to zero, exceptions will
 94/// not be thrown.  Instead, whenever the implementation would have
 95/// thrown an exception, it will instead print a diagnostic to cerr
 96/// and call abort().
 97/// FUTURE: Mode in which exceptional conditions are not detected at all.
 98
 99#ifndef VSIP_HAS_EXCEPTIONS
100// If the Intel compiler on windows is used without exception handling (-GX)
101#  if defined(__ICL) && !__EXCEPTIONS
102#    define VSIP_HAS_EXCEPTIONS 0
103#  else
104#    define VSIP_HAS_EXCEPTIONS 1
105#  endif
106#endif
107
108#if VSIP_HAS_EXCEPTIONS
109#  define VSIP_NOTHROW throw()
110#  define VSIP_THROW(x) throw x         ///< Wraps throw-specifications
111#  define VSIP_IMPL_THROW(x) throw x    ///< Wraps throw statements
112#else
113#  define VSIP_NOTHROW
114#  define VSIP_THROW(x)
115#  define VSIP_IMPL_THROW(x) vsip::impl::fatal_exception(__FILE__, __LINE__, x)
116#endif
117

125/// Value Types [support.types]
126
127typedef float scalar_f;
128typedef int scalar_i;
129typedef std::complex<scalar_f> cscalar_f;
130typedef std::complex<scalar_i> cscalar_i;
131
132// Note: complex.hpp imports std::complex into the vsip namespace.
133
134
135/// Default value type for Vectors, Matrixes, and Tensors.
136typedef scalar_f VSIP_DEFAULT_VALUE_TYPE;
137
138typedef unsigned int dimension_type;

142/// Domain types [support.types.domain]

144namespace impl 
145{
146
147typedef ptrdiff_t signed_index_type;
148typedef size_t unsigned_index_type;
149
150} // namespace vsip::impl
151
152typedef impl::unsigned_index_type index_type;
153typedef impl::signed_index_type index_difference_type;
154typedef impl::signed_index_type stride_type;
155typedef impl::unsigned_index_type stride_scalar_type;
156
157typedef index_type	length_type;
158
159
160/// Dimension Ordering [support.types.dimorder]
161
162/// Class to define dimension ordering for Dense blocks.
163///
164/// The template parameters to tuple specify the order in which
165/// logical dimensions are used to address memory, starting from
166/// major-dimension to minor-dimension.  For a contiguous data-layout,
167/// elements in the minor-dimension are unit-stride.
168///
169/// Logical dimensions are numbered from left-to-right, starting with zero.
170///
171/// For a tensor 'ten' element reference 'ten(x, y, z)',
172/// 'x' is the 0th dimension, 'y' is the 1st dimension, and 'z' is the
173/// 2nd dimension.
174///
175/// For a Matrix 'mat' element reference 'mat(r, c)',
176/// 'r' is the 0th dimension (also the row) and 'c' is the 1st dimension
177/// (also the column).
178template <dimension_type dim0 = 0,
179	  dimension_type dim1 = 1,
180	  dimension_type dim2 = 2>
181class tuple
182{
183public:
184  static dimension_type const impl_dim0 = dim0;
185  static dimension_type const impl_dim1 = dim1;
186  static dimension_type const impl_dim2 = dim2;
187};
188
189
190
191// row-major dimension orderings.
192typedef tuple<0, 1, 2>	row1_type;  ///< Convenience type for 1-dim row-major.
193typedef tuple<0, 1, 2>	row2_type;  ///< Convenience type for 2-dim row-major.
194typedef tuple<0, 1, 2>	row3_type;  ///< Convenience type for 3-dim row-major.
195
196// column-major dimension orderings.
197typedef tuple<0, 1, 2>	col1_type;  ///< Convenience type for 1-dim col-major.
198typedef tuple<1, 0, 2>	col2_type;  ///< Convenience type for 2-dim col-major.
199typedef tuple<2, 1, 0>	col3_type;  ///< Convenience type for 3-dim col-major.
200
201
202
203// Define convenience template classes Row_major and Col_major.  They
204// are used by Dense template class to choose the default dimension
205// ordering for a choosen dimension.
206namespace impl
207{
208
209template <dimension_type Dim>
210struct Row_major;
211
212template <> struct Row_major<1> { typedef row1_type type; };
213template <> struct Row_major<2> { typedef row2_type type; };
214template <> struct Row_major<3> { typedef row3_type type; };
215
216
217template <dimension_type Dim>
218struct Col_major;
219
220template <> struct Col_major<1> { typedef col1_type type; };
221template <> struct Col_major<2> { typedef col2_type type; };
222template <> struct Col_major<3> { typedef col3_type type; };
223
224
225} // namespace vsip::impl
226
227/// Map and multiprocessor types [support.types.map].
228
229template <dimension_type Dim>
230class Global_map;
231
232class Local_map;
233
234#if VSIP_IMPL_PAR_SERVICE == 2
235typedef long processor_type;
236typedef long processor_difference_type;
237#else
238typedef unsigned int processor_type;
239typedef signed int processor_difference_type;
240#endif
241
242index_type     const no_index     = static_cast<index_type>(-1);
243index_type     const no_subblock  = static_cast<index_type>(-1);
244index_type     const no_rank      = static_cast<index_type>(-1);
245processor_type const no_processor = static_cast<processor_type>(-1);
246
247
248
249/// Enumeration to indicate parallel data distribution.
250enum distribution_type
251{
252  whole,
253  block,
254  cyclic,
255  other
256};
257
258/// Enumeration to indicate how function object returns result.
259enum return_mechanism_type
260{
261  by_value,
262  by_reference
263};
264
265
266
267/// Exceptions [support.exceptions.comput].
268
269/// Class for VSIPL++ computation error exceptions.
270class computation_error : public std::runtime_error
271{
272public:
273  /// Constructor.
274  explicit	computation_error(const std::string& wstr)
275    : runtime_error(wstr)
276  {}
277   
278};
279
280namespace impl
281{
282/// This function is called instead of throwing an exception
283/// when VSIP_HAS_EXCEPTIONS is 0.
284extern void fatal_exception(char const * file, unsigned int line,
285                            std::exception const& E) VSIP_IMPL_NORETURN;
286
287
288/// Exception to mark unimplemented VSIPL++ features and functionality.
289
290/// During development, unimplemented functions will have stubs that
291/// throw this exception.
292class unimplemented : public std::runtime_error
293{
294public:
295  /// Constructor.
296  explicit unimplemented(const std::string& str)
297    : runtime_error(str)
298  {}
299   
300};
301
302} // namespace vsip::impl
303
304/// Synonyms for dimension_type [support.constants].
305
306dimension_type const row = 0;		///< Row dimension of a Matrix.
307dimension_type const col = 1;		///< Column dimension of a Matrix.
308
309dimension_type const dim0 = 0;		///< First dimension of a Tensor.
310dimension_type const dim1 = 1;		///< Second dimension of a Tensor.
311dimension_type const dim2 = 2;		///< Third dimension of a Tensor.
312
313/// Support functions [support.functions].
314
315/// Return the total number of processors executing the program.
316length_type num_processors() VSIP_NOTHROW;
317// processor_set() defined in parallel.hpp
318processor_type local_processor() VSIP_NOTHROW;
319
320} // namespace vsip

322namespace vsip_csl
323{
324// import all vsip symbols into vsip_csl
325using namespace vsip;
326// Instead of aliasing the vsip::impl namespace,
327// we create a new one, so we can add to it directly.
328namespace impl
329{
330using namespace vsip::impl;
